Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition:
Athlete \Ath"lete\, n. [L. athleta, Gr. ? prizefighter, fr. ? to contend for a prize, ?, Hom. ?, contest, ? prize; fr. the same root as E. wed: cf. F. athl[`e]te.] 1. (Antiq.) One who contended for a prize in the public games of ancient Greece or Rome. [1913 Webster]
2. Any one trained to contend in exercises requiring great physical agility and strength; one who has great activity and strength; a champion. [1913 Webster]
3. One fitted for, or skilled in, intellectual contests; as, athletes of debate. [1913 Webster]
athlete n : a person trained to compete in sports [syn: {jock}]
